question: Indian government plan to install e-Gates at airport immigration counters for whom?
explanation: From January 2019, low-risk foreign travellers will not have to wait in long queues at airport immigration counters. The Indian government plans to install special automated kiosks - e-Gates - for speedy document and identity verification. At the e-Gates, foreigners can present their machine-readable passports, place their fingerprints on the scanner and complete a customs declaration.
